qas.question: Explorers in the employ of what nation discovered the Azores?
What leader sponsored the expedition that discovered Cape Verde?
What Portuguese explorer visited India in 1498?
What did Christopher Columbus discover in 1492?
What English monarch financed John Cabot?

context: In the early 15th century, the countries of the Iberian peninsula began to sponsor exploration beyond the boundaries of Europe. <a1_0>Prince Henry the Navigator<a1_0/> of <a0_0>Portugal<a0_0/> (d. 1460) sent expeditions that discovered the Canary Islands, the Azores, and Cape Verde during his lifetime. After his death, exploration continued; Bartolomeu Dias (d. 1500) went around the Cape of Good Hope in 1486 and <a2_0>Vasco da Gama<a2_0/> (d. 1524) sailed around Africa to India in 1498. The combined Spanish monarchies of Castile and Aragon sponsored the voyage of exploration by Christopher Columbus (d. 1506) in 1492 that discovered <a3_0>the Americas<a3_0/>. The English crown under <a4_0>Henry VII<a4_0/> sponsored the voyage of John Cabot (d. 1498) in 1497, which landed on Cape Breton Island.
